results.title: The Cordellera Expedition
results.brief_description: Follows an expedition retracing the steps of Canada’s early explorers including the use of stills and archival footage. Spectacular scenery and wildlife images make this film a must for those who love the outdoors.

results.title: The Copter kids
results.creator_credit: Children's Film Foundation, Pacesetter Productions and Ronald Spencer
results.brief_description: A children’s comedy with a social message. A group of town kids form a vigilante group to stop an irresponsible cattle rustler and his two dim-witted sons from poaching cattle from Bramble Hollow to be sold to the European Communities.

results.title: The Cop and the anthem
results.creator_credit: Terry Benes, Learning Corporation of America and Peter Mark Schifter
results.brief_description: Soapy (played by Robert Morse), an affable vagrant in New York City at the turn of the century tries many ways to get himself put into jail for the winter. A classic tale of irony and pathos. Based on the short story by O. Henry.

results.title: The Cooling system and fuel system
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Demonstrates how to check for leaks in the cooling system; check the fan and water pump; mechanical operation of the carburettor; filters and vents; and fuel pumps.

results.title: The Cook the thief his wife & her lover
results.creator_credit: Kees Kasander, Allarts Cook, Erato FIlms, Films Incorporated and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description: The setting is a restaurant, La Hollondais, where the chef prepares a lavish menu every night. Among the regular customers are Albert Spica (Michael Gambon) a loud-mouthed, violent gangster who dines with his entourage of seedy men, and his bored, beautiful wife, Georgina (Helen Mirren). At another table each night sits Michael, a quiet man who’s always reading. He and Georgina soon begin a series of secret rendezvous, where they make passionate love. Eventually Albert discovers his wife’s infidelity and takes violent revenge, triggering a more unusual retaliation from her. This film is a parable about love, revenge and most of all greed, it is both funny and horrifying. Sacha Vierny’s cinematography and Greenaway’s use of colour are superb. Also stars Tim Roth, Richard Bohringer and Alan Howard.

results.title: The Conversation
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Paramount Pictures and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays Harry Caul, an expert surveillance man, who during a routine wire-tapping job hears snatches of conversation which make him believe a young couple is in danger. The more Harry tries to discover the secret surrounding the couple, the more he descends into a nightmare of secrecy, betrayal and murder, all taking place amidst a world of moral ambivalence. Influenced by the Watergate scandals of the early 1970’s, “The Conversation” is a tense and excellently edited suspense thriller. It is also Coppola’s most anguished and personal film.

results.title: The Control revolution
results.creator_credit: KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.), National Educational Television and Richard Moore
results.brief_description: Explains how the development of the computer has made possible the automatic control of routine tasks in government, industry and business. Presents various computer systems ranging from data processing applications to mechanical control systems. Introduces basic concepts in business information systems including feedback, decision making processes and data modelling.

results.title: The Control of worms in sheep
results.creator_credit: Ritter-Jepperson Studios and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Two neighbours, who own adjoining properties, both attempt to combat this disease in their sheep. The sheep in the first property are suffering from the combined effects of overstocking and worm parasites. On the second property, after a period of trial and error, what is termed correct stocking is achieved, and as a result, the worm problem solves itself. The film emphasises that sheep must be drenched at the right time and properly fed all the time.

results.title: The Control of working capital (NP)
results.brief_description: Designed to explain the essentials of business finance to people without any financial background. Uses a dramatic format to explain how a cash crisis can be avoided by reducing working capital in four key areas: purchasing, manufacturing, sales, and credit control. Starring John Cleese and Ronnie Corbett and written by Antony Jay (of “Yes Prime Minister” fame). Suitable for upper secondary level.
